intro: Pollichia montana, commonly known as the mountain polly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other familiar plants like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
